summary: This is an email exchange from March 1, 2019, between Stacie B. Harris of the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) and two supervisors from the Public Corruption Unit of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The SDNY supervisors are reaching out to connect regarding the office's Epstein investigation, indicating coordination between Main Justice and the SDNY on the case.

persons.name: Stacie B. Harris
persons.role: Attorney, Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG)
persons.context: The recipient of an email from SDNY supervisors, responding to schedule a call regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: SDNY Public Corruption Unit Reaches Out to Main Justice
events.description: Two supervisors from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit email Stacie B. Harris at ODAG to introduce themselves and request a call regarding the SDNY's Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduling Call on Epstein Investigation
events.description: Stacie B. Harris responds to the SDNY supervisors, offering availability for a phone call later that day to discuss the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) had an active Epstein investigation as of February/March 2019.
The SDNY's Public Corruption Unit was involved in the Epstein investigation.
There was direct communication and coordination between the SDNY and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (Main Justice) regarding the Epstein case.
The email indicates the involvement of at least one line Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) in the SDNY unit, whose name is redacted in the text.
